5. Calls on all parties to respect the cessation of hostilities, prevent Blue Line violations, and cooperate with the UN and UNIFIL.

6. Urges parties to respect UNIFIL's safety and freedom of movement, and cooperate with Lebanese Armed Forces on coordinated patrols; reiterates the need to bring perpetrators of attacks on UNIFIL to justice.

7. Urges parties to cooperate with the Security Council and Secretary-General to make progress towards a permanent ceasefire and long-term solution as envisioned in resolution 1701 (2006).

8. Urges Israel to withdraw its army from northern Ghajar without delay, in coordination with UNIFIL.

9. Reaffirms the need for an area free of armed personnel and weapons between the Blue Line and Litani River, except for Lebanese government and UNIFIL personnel.

10. Welcomes UNIFIL's efforts to implement the zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse, and requests the Secretary-General to keep the Security Council informed.

11. Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation of resolution 1701 (2006) every four months.

12. Stresses the need for a comprehensive, just, and lasting peace in the Middle East, based on relevant resolutions.

13. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
